title: Metaverse-Based Collective Intelligence Development Project

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary digital literacy and intermediate expertise in scientific fields
context.additional_context: A science-focused problem-solving project conducted via a metaverse platform in a smartphone-based, limited-technology environment.

learning_goals: Learners can form virtual teams of 3–5 members on a metaverse platform (e.g., Gather.town, Zepeto), design a three-stage collaborative process (problem definition → solution derivation → simulation verification) for a given scientific problem (e.g., improving energy efficiency in a virtual factory), and present prototype execution results in a 5-minute presentation within one week.
Enhancing 21st-century leadership competencies (communication, critical thinking, creativity) through blended virtual-real experiences.

Learners can develop one project prototype related to a science field (e.g., environmental monitoring) within one week by applying the experiential learning cycle (action → reflection → improvement), and submit a final report reflecting three major improvement suggestions from peer evaluations and expert reviews.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
